name: predasetex
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: eqeltri(cpred(c0, c1, c2), universe, cin(c1, cima(ccnv(c0), csn(c2))))
stmt.pretty: eqeltri(Pred(c0, c1, c2), universe, (c1 ⋂(`' c0 " { c2 })))

body.origin:
|- wcel(cpred(c0, c1, c2), universe)
-| wceq(cpred(c0, c1, c2), cin(c1, cima(ccnv(c0), csn(c2))))
-| wcel(cin(c1, cima(ccnv(c0), csn(c2))), universe)

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(cpred(c0, c1, c2), universe)
-| wceq(cpred(c0, c1, c2), cin(c1, cima(ccnv(c0), csn(c2))))
-| wcel(cin(c1, cima(ccnv(c0), csn(c2))), universe)

body.origin: |- wceq(cpred(c0, c1, c2), cin(c1, cima(ccnv(c0), csn(c2))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(cpred(c0, c1, c2), universe)
-| wcel(cin(c1, cima(ccnv(c0), csn(c2))), universe)

body.origin:
|- wcel(cin(c1, cima(ccnv(c0), csn(c2))), universe)
-| wcel(c1, universe)

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(cpred(c0, c1, c2), universe)
-| wcel(c1, universe)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ Pred(c0, c1, c2)∈ 𝕌
⊣ c1 ∈ 𝕌

comment: The predecessor class exists when ` A ` does. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 8-Feb-2011.)
